Today’s makers.
Tomorrow’s life changers.


Chicago Session (Nov 20)
Sign-up for our sessions here!
MakerGirl’s Birthday (Nov 30)

Brings 3D printing
to life

MakerGirl sessions are for girls aged 7-10 and are led by university STEM women. All of our sessions teach young girls 3D printing, while also teaching them about women leaders in STEM fields, innovative companies, cutting edge technology, and much more. We want your MakerGirl to come to our session and depart wanting to actively participate in any and all parts of STEM!



Mission

Inspire girls to be active in STEM



Vision

Girls live and dream as unstoppable forces that say yes to the challenges of the future which leads to gender equality in all workplaces

Events

Please sign up for all of our sessions in Champaign, Southern Illinois, and Chicago via Eventbrite. Please be cautious when signing up for sessions due to the different locations! For information about scholarships please email info@makergirl.us. We want every girl to attend our session, so we look forward to providing you with assistance.

Champaign

The Business Instructional Facility
515 E Gregory Avenue Champaign, IL 61820
Room 3030

Enter via the east entrance and use the stairs directly after the first set of doors to your right for easiest entry.

Chicago

The 3D Printer Experience
333 N LaSalle St, Chicago, IL

Southern Illinois

Illinois Star Centre Mall
3000 W Deyoung St #604, Marion, IL 62959


Donate

All donations go to fund scholarships for underprivileged girls and will also fund our big goals to reach girls in rural areas who do not have access to STEM-related opportunities.




PayPal

Paypal is a one-time donation website

Patreon

Patreon enables donors to pledge any amount of funds per session


Absolutely any of your donations are greatly appreciated. Please email us at info@makergirl.us for tax exemption information to ensure that your donation is tax exempt.

Today’s makers.

As featured on





Testimonials

“As a graduate of the University of Illinois College of Business, and mother of two daughters, I am excited to see this program grow. My girls thoroughly enjoy the MakerGirl sessions. In addition to providing project based learning in the STEM areas, this program promotes female leaders and entrepreneurs. This program plants seeds that will create the next generation of change!”

- Kelly Duitsman Loschen
“She furrows her brow and says, ‘Daddy, I’m NOT you’re baby girl. I’m a MakerGirl!’ It’s cute, but also a rather powerful statement. She successfully self identifies as a future builder of technology.”

- Nick Timmons
“At the age of 7 all I really need out of this is for my daughter to be safe and excited about learning new things. Every experience contributes to her overall understanding of the world and her options and place within that world. Showing her how fun STEM fields can be simply keeps her mind open to this possibility.”

- MakerGirl Parent
